sectionCopy.name: Barriers
sectionCopy.value: Ministry of economy, trade and industry (METI) governs energy markets and energy policy. The impact of incumbent utilities is big in rule making for energy policy. As METI tightens policy on solar projects, many renewable energy developers have been getting into offshore wind markets.

sectionCopy.name: Clean energy policy
sectionCopy.value: Clean energy target for 2030, 22-24% of total generation is achievable. The target is scheduled to be revised in 2021. Feed-in tariff will shift to feed-in premium in 2022/23. It gives uncertanties to developers as the details of the FiP base price and reference wholesale price is yet finalized. Retroactive changes to existing renewable assets are in discussion. Notable example is fixed monthly charge for grid use.

sectionCopy.name: Doing business
sectionCopy.value: Power demand is expected to fall due to shrinking population, high energy efficiency and slowdown in economy.

sectionCopy.name: Power market
sectionCopy.value: Vast majority of generation assets higher than 85% are owned by the incumbent utilities, which makes new retailers difficult to compete in retail markets. As power demand is expected to fall due to shrinking population and slowdown in economy, opportunity for new capacity addition is very limited except for replacement of retired old capacities. Coal and gas accounts for 68% of generation while growth in solar capacity expected to be the largest in 2020. We expect 7GW of capacity to be added this year. Japan has 10 different power markets and each region is poorly connected, resulting in price distortion between east and west regions in wholesale market.

sectionCopy.name: Power prices and LCOEs
sectionCopy.value: Power retail price has been rising despite the retail deregulation in April 2016, due to the slow restart of nuclear reactors, generous feed-in tariff rates and growing renewables. This year we may be able to see some drop in the power price thanks to the low oil prices. LCOE for solar and wind has been the world's highest. Capex and opex may fall to some extent but not enough to reach global average.
